Posts.Content: Hey Lellyv, Unfortunately I have no advice to give you but am in a similar situation. I also live alone and have been diagnosed HER2 +. I was diagnosed on 28th Feb and like you have to get chemo first but because there is no availability of heart scans till the 9th of April - I probably  wont start treatment until the following week. I'm finding it all pretty surreal to be honest as I feel well and at present look well. What I've decided to do this week is clean my entire house, batch cook and freeze dinners in case I feel poorly and do a Tesco delivery shop of things I may need. Have you looked in the chemotherapy hints and tips section ( actually this might be on breast cancer org uk) - Im on both.  I'm also going to go and make an appt to look at wigs because I'm not going to try cold capping. Although I have read everybody responds to chemo completely differently so what I'm doing is really probably just keeping myself busy and distracting myself. Let me know how you get on. onwards and upwards on our journey. We can do this x ps There is lots of advice on this forum I have found it really helpful.
